definition: to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
night
variant of 夜[ye4]
to stay up through the night (idiom)

sentences.english: The night watchman brought the armchair for Hewson. He tried to make him laugh.
sentences.chinese: 守夜人给休森搬来了一张椅子，顺便逗一下他。

sentences.english: Early in the book, Jerry's friend known as The Goober gets an assignment from The Vigils.
sentences.chinese: 早在这本书中，杰里的朋友称为花生获得转让从守夜。

sentences.english: The night watchmen who apprehended the thief was praised for his vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 捉住小偷的守夜人因其警惕性而受到人们的赞扬。

sentences.english: We waited in hope on Saturday's Vigil.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣周六的守夜中期待。

sentences.english: Candlelight vigils and community arts project are also scheduled tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天还将进行烛光守夜和社区艺术项目活动。

sentences.english: By many all-night vigils , passions he tamed.
sentences.chinese: 由许多通宵的守夜，他驯养了的热情。

sentences.english: Since then KuErBan sticks in hand every day for her vigil.
sentences.chinese: 从此库尔班每天手握棍棒为阿娜尔罕守夜。

sentences.english: Why, at the old watchman’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在那个老守夜人的屋子里。

sentences.english: Hewson laughed and said goodnight to the man.
sentences.chinese: 休森哈哈大笑，然后跟守夜人说了晚安。

sentences.english: The teacher pernoctated with the students once.
sentences.chinese: 老师曾有一次与学生们通宵守夜。

sentences.english: The company excused the watchman for falling asleep while on duty.
sentences.chinese: 公司原谅了那位守夜值班时睡着觉的看守员。

sentences.english: The dog kept vigil over his sleeping master.
sentences.chinese: 这条狗为他入睡的主人守夜。

definition: on night duty
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to guard/to watch over
shift working
to keep watch beside a coffin
to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
to see in the New Year/to stay up all night on lunar New Year's Eve
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
sentinel
dawn/daybreak
to go to bed/to retire for the night
to camp/to lodge
nightfall
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
